message.content: This question tests knowledge about measuring tools and their ability to determine the exact size of an object. Option (B), a plastic tape with graduated markings, is the correct answer. Graduated markings on a measuring tape provide precise measurements, allowing for the exact size of an object to be determined. Option (A), a plain stick with an irregular shape, does not have any markings or measurement indicators, so it cannot provide precise measurements. Option (C), a thermometer with mercury in it, is used to measure temperature, not size. Option (D), a metal cooking spoon, is not a measuring tool and does not have any markings for determining size.

This question is asking which tool is most suitable for measuring the exact size of an object. Option (B) is the correct answer because a plastic tape with graduated markings, like a measuring tape, is specifically designed for measuring length or size accurately. It provides precise measurements in a standardized format. 

Option (A) is incorrect because a plain stick with an irregular shape would not provide accurate measurements as there are no standard markings for measurement.

Option (C) is incorrect because a thermometer with mercury in it is used to measure temperature, not size or length.

Option (D) is incorrect because a metal cooking spoon is not designed for measuring size or length accurately.

To determine the exact size of an object, we need a tool that can provide precise measurements. Option (B) is the correct choice because a plastic tape with graduated markings, such as a ruler or measuring tape, can be used to measure the length or dimensions of an object accurately. Option (A) is incorrect because a plain stick with an irregular shape would not provide standardized measurements. Option (C) is incorrect because a thermometer with mercury is used to measure temperature, not size. Option (D) is incorrect because a metal cooking spoon is not designed for measuring size.
